data.event: The first post office was named Mouth of Beaver and was established on August 21, 1854 (Thomas P. Johns, postmaster).

data.event: In 1905, another post office opened and was named Allen after local resident, T.J. Allen. The town was formally incorporated by the state assembly in 1913.
In 1936, the railroad station was renamed to prevent confusion during mail delivery.
The section of the city known as New Allen began to develop in 1937 after a bridge was constructed across the Levisa Fork River.
